column4: can anyone tell me might uninstalling totem stop all these problems? they do seem to originate from totem
worth a try, you can always reinstall it
sudo apt-get --purge remove totem; sudo apt-get --purge autoremove
it will remove the totem plugin from firefox if you use it
thats what the autoremove is for ;)
i'd agree
mplayer is awesome
ok done
use alacarte to remove it then
press alt+f2   type   alacarte   press enter
look at the structre, you will see it matches the apps menu
so you can then open the mutimedia section on the left and untick the entry for totem or whatever you want hiding
your call
alacarte helps you remove the item, click multimedia on the left panel, then untick the box nxt to totem
if you ran the uninstall commands earlier it will have uninstalled the app
seems weird its not removed from the menu too
if you run:   dpkg -l | grep tote     does it show up?
the dpkg will sow the totem packages installed, you need to make sure they are uninstalled if they relate to totem or are totem
cool
ext3 is fine
im dont consider myself anyone who should attempt something like that
until support stops it should do
for as long as the release is supported, the packages will be updated as and when
april 2011 for desktop
